p: The temporal and geographic distance conveyed in a frame can shape its effect on public opinion. While some studies suggest that localized effects of climate change will most robustly shape individualsâ€™ beliefs about climate change [ 20, 47, 48], there is also evidence that people perceive climate change as more severe when framed as a geographically and temporally distant phenomenon versus a local phenomenon [ 49, 50]. In line with the latter findings, our frames conceptualize climate change as a global phenomenon.
